title: Abdul Taib in KL for treatment — IGP
summary: KUALA LUMPUR (Feb 10): The Inspector-General of Police Tan Sri Razarudin Husain has confirmed that the former Sarawak Yang Dipertua Negeri Tun Abdul Taib Mahmud is receiving treatment at a private hospital here.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Feb 10): The Inspector-General of Police Tan Sri Razarudin Husain has confirmed that the former Sarawak Yang Dipertua Negeri Tun Abdul Taib Mahmud is receiving treatment at a private hospital here.

Concerning this, he advised the public not to spread unverified information that could lead to speculations.

Razarudin said the police report that went viral claiming Abdul Taib was removed from a hospital was valid, which led to an investigation under S

title: FlyDubai’s maiden flight arrived in Langkawi on Feb 10 — Langkawi Development Authority
summary: ALOR SETAR (Feb 10): FlyDubai's inaugural flight from Dubai, United Arab Emirates (UAE) landed in Langkawi Island on Saturday.
content:
ALOR SETAR (Feb 10): FlyDubai's inaugural flight from Dubai, United Arab Emirates (UAE) landed in Langkawi Island on Saturday.

The flight arrival at 4.25pm was greeted by the management of Langkawi Development Authority (Lada), Tourism Malaysia, Malaysia Airports Holdings Bhd (MAHB), government agencies and Langkawi's tourism industry players.

Lada chief executive officer Datuk Haslina Abdul Hamid said FlyDubai's flight route originates from Terminal 2 of D

title: Türkiye tourist arrivals in Malaysia increased 10.8% in Jan-Nov 2023 compared to 2019 figures
summary: SEPANG (Feb 10): Türkiye tourist arrivals into Malaysia for the period January to November 2023 showed an increase of 10.8% or 15,623 people, compared to 14,096 in the same period in 2019.
content:
SEPANG (Feb 10): Türkiye tourist arrivals into Malaysia for the period January to November 2023 showed an increase of 10.8% or 15,623 people, compared to 14,096 in the same period in 2019.

Ministry of Tourism, Arts and Culture (Motac) secretary general Datuk Roslan Abdul Rahman said this increase reflects the success of Motac’s campaign to promote Malaysia as an attractive destination for foreign tourists.

"This figure shows a good improvement. Why am I comparin

title: CNY: Joyous Year of the Dragon celebration nationwide
summary: KUALA LUMPUR (Feb 10): The Chinese community nationwide ushered in the Year of the Dragon on Saturday, a symbol of strength, honour, success and good fortune.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Feb 10): The Chinese community nationwide ushered in the Year of the Dragon on Saturday, a symbol of strength, honour, success and good fortune.

The Lunar New Year celebrations were also welcomed by Malaysians of various ethnicities across the country, as they took advantage of the long weekend holidays to spend quality time with their families.

title: Fahmi: Muhyiddin spreading fake news on petition’s landmark judgement
summary: KUALA LUMPUR (Feb 10): Communications Minister Fahmi Fadzil said the statement issued by Perikatan Nasional (PN) chairman Tan Sri Muhyiddin Yassin regarding the decision of the Federal Court to nullify 16 provisions of offences under the Kelantan Syariah Criminal Code (1) Enactment 2019, is untrue.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Feb 10): Communications Minister Fahmi Fadzil said the statement issued by Perikatan Nasional (PN) chairman Tan Sri Muhyiddin Yassin regarding the decision of the Federal Court to nullify 16 provisions of offences under the Kelantan Syariah Criminal Code (1) Enactment 2019, is untrue.

He said this in response to Muhyiddin's claims that with the ruling, some acts which are against Islamic law will no longer be offences in the state.

“Muhyi

title: PM: 2024 the year to focus on economic development, regain country’s respect
summary: KUALA LUMPUR (Feb 10): Economic development and promoting investment are the focus of the Madani government in restoring Malaysia's status as a respected country, said Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Feb 10): Economic development and promoting investment are the focus of the Madani government in restoring Malaysia's status as a respected country, said Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim.

The Prime Minister said that to realise this, the Cabinet has set several matters in terms of economic development to be emphasised and implemented this year, including increasing investment and developing the country's capabilities in all areas such as education, health and culture.

title: G25 Malaysia commends Federal Court for landmark judgement on Kelantan Syariah Criminal Code petition
summary: G25 commends the Federal Court for its landmark judgement in Petition No.: BKA-2-05/2022(D) in declaring that several provisions/sections of the Kelantan Syariah Criminal Code (I) [Enactment 14] Enactment 2019 are null and void for being in violation of the Federal Constitution.
content:
G25 commends the Federal Court for its landmark judgement in Petition No.: BKA-2-05/2022(D) in declaring that several provisions/sections of the Kelantan Syariah Criminal Code (I) [Enactment 14] Enactment 2019 are null and void for being in violation of the Federal Constitution.

The judgement was delivered on Friday, 9 February, 2024. 

G25 also applauds Nik Elin Zurina Nik Abdul Rashid and her daughter Tengku Yasmin Natasha Tengku Abdul Rahman for thei

title: Brazilian president Lula keen on Malaysian semiconductor sector, welcomes Anwar ahead of G20 Summit
summary: KUALA LUMPUR (Feb 10): Brazilian president Luis Inacio Lula da Silva has reiterated his interest in partnerships with Malaysia, especially in the semiconductor sector, in his phone conversation with Malaysian Prime Minister Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Feb 10): Brazilian president Luis Inacio Lula da Silva has reiterated his interest in partnerships with Malaysia, especially in the semiconductor sector, in his phone conversation with Malaysian Prime Minister Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim.

Anwar spoke with da Silva on the telephone on Friday (Feb 9), where the two leaders spoke about expanding trade relations, the fight against inequality and hunger, calls for ceasefire in Gaza, and a reform of the global governance system, according to a statement b

title: PM attends MCA Chinese New Year gathering
summary: KUALA LUMPUR (Feb 10): Prime Minister Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim attended the Chinese New Year celebration hosted by MCA at Wisma MCA here on Saturday.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Feb 10): Prime Minister Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim attended the Chinese New Year celebration hosted by MCA at Wisma MCA here on Saturday.

Anwar's arrival at 10am was greeted by MCA president Datuk Seri Dr Wee Ka Siong.

Also present were the Deputy Prime Minister Datuk Seri Dr Ahmad Zahid Hamidi, who is also Barisan Nasional (BN) chairman and Umno president; Umno deputy president Datuk Seri Mohamad Hasan, and MIC deputy president Datuk Seri

title: CNY: May the Dragon Year bring happiness, prosperity — Nanta
summary: KUALA LUMPUR (Feb 10): Works Minister Datuk Seri Alexander Nanta Linggi extended Chinese New Year greetings on Saturday to those celebrating, with the hope that the arrival of the Year of the Dragon will bring good fortune, happiness and prosperity.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Feb 10): Works Minister Datuk Seri Alexander Nanta Linggi extended Chinese New Year greetings on Saturday to those celebrating, with the hope that the arrival of the Year of the Dragon will bring good fortune, happiness and prosperity.

Nanta, in a Facebook post, also advised people who are returning to their hometowns or going on vacation to plan their trips well.

“In conjunction with the Year of the Dragon, I hope [that] Chines

title: My Say: Putting glamour into science: A whimsical journey
summary: Staying and working near the National Stadium in Bukit Jalil is a mixed bag of blessings and challenges. On the positive side, residents in the vicinity get to enjoy the ambient sounds of free concerts and the energetic cheers of football fans during matches. The challenges, however, are in the f...
content:
This article first appeared in Forum, The Edge Malaysia Weekly on February 5, 2024 - February 11, 2024

Staying and working near the National Stadium in Bukit Jalil is a mixed bag of blessings and challenges. On the positive side, residents in the vicinity get to enjoy the ambient sounds of free concerts and the energetic cheers of football fans during matches. The challenges, however, are in the form of traffic gridlocks, especially before and after events.

title: Bursa Malaysia to remain quiet in first trading week of Lunar New Year
summary: KUALA LUMPUR (Feb 10): Bursa Malaysia is likely to remain quiet next week, following the Chinese New Year holiday, said an analyst.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Feb 10): Bursa Malaysia is likely to remain quiet next week, following the Chinese New Year holiday, said an analyst. 

SPI Asset Management managing partner Stephen Innes said investors would need to navigate several important data points, with the main one being the US consumer price index to be released on Tuesday (Feb 13). 

“Barring any significantly hotter inflation surprise, Bursa Malaysia should remain supported by the outlook for U

title: CNY: Loke thanks AirAsia for providing additional midnight flights to Sabah, Sarawak at fixed rates
summary: KUALA LUMPUR (Feb 10): Transport Minister Anthony Loke Siew Fook thanked AirAsia on Friday (Feb 9) night for supporting the government’s initiative in providing more additional midnight flights at fixed rates to Sabah, Sarawak and Labuan during the ongoing Lunar New Year festive season.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Feb 10): Transport Minister Anthony Loke Siew Fook thanked AirAsia on Friday (Feb 9) night for supporting the government’s initiative in providing more additional midnight flights at fixed rates to Sabah, Sarawak and Labuan during the ongoing Lunar New Year festive season.

In a video post on Facebook, Loke said the initiative taken by the local carrier has made it more affordable for Sabahans and Sarawakians to fly home to celebrate the Chinese New Year, with fares as low as RM298.

title: Reviving FGV
summary: KUALA LUMPUR (Feb 10): The relationship between FGV Holdings Bhd and its statutory body parent, the Federal Land Development Authority (Felda), is a complicated one.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Feb 10): The relationship between FGV Holdings Bhd and its statutory body parent, the Federal Land Development Authority (Felda), is a complicated one.

After Felda’s failed attempt to privatise FGV that dragged on for years, both parties seem to be stuck between a rock and a hard place.

Sources say that Felda, which now owns an 82% stake in FGV, is still keen to pursue its plan to privatise the agribusiness group.

title: Malaysia's foreign portfolio outflow widens to RM5.1b in January
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: Malaysia's foreign portfolio outflow widened in January, as foreigners net sold RM5.1 billion worth of debt securities.The foreign outfllow stood at RM1.9 billion in December 2023, UOB Global Economics & Market research said.It said January saw ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: Malaysia's foreign portfolio outflow widened in January, as foreigners net sold RM5.1 billion worth of debt securities.

The foreign outfllow stood at RM1.9 billion in December 2023, UOB Global Economics & Market research said.

It said January saw the largest net selling of bonds in 15 months.

"This is more than offset foreign net buying of Malaysian equities for a third straight month," it said in a note.

Foreigners net bought RM0.7 billion worth of Malaysian equities.

UOB said Ban

title: Interpacific Asset Management expects FBM KLCI to hover around 1,600 mark in 2024
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: The FTSE Bursa Malaysia KLCI (FBM KLCI) is expected to hover around the 1,600 mark in 2024, supported by resilient economic growth, improving corporate earnings, and attractive valuations, according to Interpacific Asset Management.Its chief economist and fund manager Datuk ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: The FTSE Bursa Malaysia KLCI (FBM KLCI) is expected to hover around the 1,600 mark in 2024, supported by resilient economic growth, improving corporate earnings, and attractive valuations, according to Interpacific Asset Management.

Its chief economist and fund manager Datuk Dr Nazri Khan foresees the FBM KLCI trending around 15 times the market price-to-earnings ratio (PER), in line with the consensus range of 14.7 times to 15.2 times.

He noted that the performance in January 2024 also earmarked the third c

title: No change to 'buy' call on suncon
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: Sunway Construction Group Bhd (SunCon) may serve as a stand-in for future infrastructure project rollouts, a burgeoning data centre industry, and a parent-company empire, according to Hong Leong Investment Bank Bhd (HLIB).In contrast to its typical target ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: Sunway Construction Group Bhd (SunCon) may serve as a stand-in for future infrastructure project rollouts, a burgeoning data centre industry, and a parent-company empire, according to Hong Leong Investment Bank Bhd (HLIB).

In contrast to its typical target of RM2 billion, SunCon has decided to set a base case target of RM2.5 billion to RM3 billion for the financial year 2024 (FY24).

According to HLIB, this will be somewhat alleviated by pending tenders, wherein awards may extend beyond FY24.

title: 'I didn't retire, I resigned'
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: A poser over 'retire or resign" has cropped up following the departure of General Tan Sri Raja Mohamed Affandi Raja Mohamed Noor as chairman of Lembaga Tabung Angkatan Tentera (LTAT).LTAT on Thursday announced that Raja Mohamed Affandi ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: A poser over 'retire or resign" has cropped up following the departure of General Tan Sri Raja Mohamed Affandi Raja Mohamed Noor as chairman of Lembaga Tabung Angkatan Tentera (LTAT).

LTAT on Thursday announced that Raja Mohamed Affandi had retired effective immediately. But in his letter to Defence Ministry secretary-general Datuk Seri Isham Ishak sighted by Business Times, Raja Mohamed Affandi stated that he had resigned.

""I didn't retire, I resigned. Being fired, retiring and resigning are diff

title: CNY 2024: Ahmad Zahid hopes Year of the Dragon will bring joy, strengthen unity among the people
summary: KUALA LUMPUR (Feb 9): Deputy Prime Minister Datuk Seri Dr Ahmad Zahid Hamidi wishes the Chinese community who will be celebrating the festival on Saturday (Feb 10) a Happy Chinese New Year, with the hope that the arrival of the Year of the Dragon will further strengthen racial unity in the country.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Feb 9): Deputy Prime Minister Datuk Seri Dr Ahmad Zahid Hamidi wishes the Chinese community who will be celebrating the festival on Saturday (Feb 10) a Happy Chinese New Year, with the hope that the arrival of the Year of the Dragon will further strengthen racial unity in the country.

Ahmad Zahid, who is Umno president, is confident that the Chinese New Year celebration will bring joy and further strengthen the bond of unity and kinship among the people.
